settings.title: Empowering Hope: The Remarkable Work of Save the Children Charity
settings.text: In a world where countless children face poverty, conflict, and limited access to education and healthcare, organisations like Save the Children stand as beacons of hope. This global charity, founded over a century ago, has been unwavering in its mission to help every child get the chance of the future they deserve. In the UK and around the world, they make sure children keep safe, healthy and learning. Let's delve into the incredible work of Save the Children and the impact they've made on children's lives worldwide.

settings.grid-title: Operates in more than 100 countries, providing vital support
settings.grid-content:
Education: They work in the UK and around the world to help children keep learning, making friends and building their futures. 

Healthcare: Delivering essential healthcare services and supplies, and combating malnutrition.  

Child Protection: Millions of children live in conflict zones, experience trafficking or are forced into armed groups, early marriage and child labour.

Emergencies: Delivers urgent healthcare, food and shelter. Even after a crisis is out of the headlines, they stay as long as children need them.

We have once again partnered with the Save the children fund. Sophie Ellis-Bextor, the beloved singer, and mother of five, has long been an ambassador for Save The Children.  

Her passion for supporting this charitable organisation took a creative turn this year when she collaborated with Chinti & Parker to design a limited-edition 'mini-me' recycled cashmere blend jumper that's available for both adults and children.  

This striking red sweater, knitted from 70% recycled merino and 30% sustainable cashmere, showcases an intarsia pink heart bearing the word 'Love,' inspired by Sophie's own tattoo on her arm. The jumpers retail at £95 and £45 respectively for adults and children, with 100% of the profits being donated to Save the Children. 

With every purchase, a complimentary tattoo sheet will be included, and these sheets will also be available for individual purchase at £5 each. The proceeds from these sales will support the treatment of children with pneumonia and the provision of birth kits for midwives.
